Grab your friends, split a cab, bring ones -- did I mention the photobooth? One last warning - a hot girl friend and i did have TWO strips of pictures consecutively stolen from the drop slot one very intoxicated evening.  This incident still under investigation.
author: Frances L.

description:
Update 1/11/07: Now this place is called Knockout and it's still pretty hip. Was there last night with some friends. I bought a round that included 1 Racer 5, 2 Stellas, 1 Pacifico and a Vodka Tonic, the total was $14.50. 'Nuff said. On Wednesdays, stop in for happy hour where one of the previous chefs from Tokyo Go Go makes fresh sushi at knockout prices.

-----

The infamous Odeon, home to some truly wacky and out there entertainment on almost any night of the week. Bad Bad Karaoke, if they still do it, is worth checking out. On quieter nights, this is a cool bar just to hang out at.
author: Nish N.

description:
I joined friends here who are regulars of the Thursday Beer Bingo. So much fun!!!

A little crowded and disorienting, but the bartenders are efficient and friendly, and the crowd is a good mix of hipsters, comedians, drunks, and nice people (like me).

My friend won a cute rug (how random are these prizes? I love it!). A couple weeks ago, another one of my friends won a bottle of mistable KY lube. Ahhhh, yes:-)

Definitely going to be a somewhat regular place to hang out at when I'm in the Mission on a random weekday night.
author: Judy F.

description:
It's a decent place - a little on the small side, but most bars around SF are.  I came here awhile back for their bingo night.

Needless to say...the pair of underwear that I won from a round of bingo left a little to be desired as a prize, but that adds flair to the place in my book.

Overall, had a good experience, but not amazing, and it's quite a ways south -- not sure I'd make it a destination spot.  Probably a good place to stop off for a drink after dinner at some of the restaurants around Bernal.
author: John B.

description:
My cousin was in town (I know, I repeat myself), and on her last night we decided to do dinner and drinks and photo booth madness.

Apparently, it was some crazy donut night, with claws, and a fashion show?? I really have no idea what was going on, but I work with the doorguy and he said we should come, so we did. 

It was crowded, and again, we were confused, so we just grabbed a couple of (cheap well) drinks and hit the photo booth. Three bucks, color, four photo strip = four stars. Fair enough?

I might come back, if I'm ever way out in this neighborhood again on a normal, non donut night. (Who am I kidding...they have the only traditional color photo booth that I know of in the city. I'll more than likely be back for that reason alone)
author: Vanessa R.

description:
I went to go see my roomates former band play.

It was pretty nice. I like the grungy feel to it all. Indie rock is a nice complement to this place. 

I don't know what else to say, other than I enjoyed the environment.
author: Eugenia Y.

description:
I have frequented the Knockout for some time now and Saturday seems to be my favorite night of the week thus far. the space is moderate but the crowd's make it feel very intimate at times. divided spaces for drinking/dancing and drinking/socializing at the top of your lungs due to the great selection of music that the DJ's often spit out. if you're looking to dance with a group of friends, this venue will provide all night. the drink selection is on the skim side, beers and mixed drinks, but is often overshadowed by how much of a blast your having at this place. the small cover at the door is definitely worth it. 

oh and aesthetically, if you remember to look around before you start drinking there is awesome artwork scattered throughout the place. the photobooth is money as well.
author: Earlvin R.

description:
Wednesday night Ichi sushi RULES!  If you ask me, it is WAY too inexpensive for the quality...

Great bar to hang in...

Affordable quality all-around...what's not to love?!
author: Sandy K.

description:
4 stars in less than 20words:

Wednesday night delicious sushi in cozy bar with 1940s stripper clips on the telly for very little money, yeah!
author: Tatjana G.

description:
Well, I've only been to Knockout for Bingo on Thursdays and it's always a great time.  It's dark and divey, which I love, and I dig the decor-especially the mug shots of Alcatraz inmates-they all look so evil.  Anyway, Thursday Bingo is a lot of fun.  You get one card for every drink you buy.  Last week I won the blackout round and won 2 drink tickets and 2 prizes!  I picked out a little plant as one of my prizes and I'm going to try my best not to kill it...I don't have a very green thumb.  

By the way, I'm not a "hipster."  I don't look like a hipster.  I don't pretend to be a hipster, but I have never felt uncomfortable or out of place in Knockout.  Maybe the Thursday Bingo crowd is a bit different than the regular crowd, but don't let the negative reviews of the "hipsters" keep you away.
author: Sara H.

description:
I love Sushi Happy Hour on Wednesday, the killer Motown music they always play, the bartender who can make you a mixed drink you've never heard of and will order again and again, the photobooth, the tall stools, the proximity to excellent burritos, the general lack of pretension, and the decent prices. 

Hooray for The Knockout!
author: Erica F.

description:
So dark my I can feel my pupils straining to dilate turning my eyes into that of a sleestack. Whoa... pretty cool. 

I didn't realize Thursday was a bingo night until the large and friendly bartender gave us a board per drink. I was thinking, wtf? But, turned out to be fun. The hostess perhaps being key to making it that way. Lit up bingo board display is doing it right.

After bingo, the first band of the night began to play, the singer being in a near devil-possessed frenzy,, and I felt like the guy in one of those pictures where the wind is hitting is face so hard, his face begins to distort from the sheer force.

Only my second time here, definitely won't be my last.
author: Boris C.

description:
Deep into one of my numerous tallboy cans of Tecate at the Knockout one night, I text messaged my friend who used to live in Chicago: "knockout sf = empty bottle." Anyone who's scoped the music scene in the Windy City should be able to recognize what that means. It means that, like the Empty Bottle in Chicago, the Knockout SF is a cool place to see some cool indie/punk bands and, sometimes, try to ignore all the people who are simply TOO cool.

Yes, the Knockout can occasionally suffer from infestations of Hipsteris Elitus. Like a few weeks ago, when an Israeli band set things on fire, poured beer down their own trousers, played on top of the bar, and rode a kick-drum over the audience's outstretched arms while banging out primal rock'n'roll rhythms --- and yet there were still groups of skinny-teed trendoids who dared to stand around, slouching and glaring through their bangs and acting as if it was all SO boring and, omigod, can I BE any less excited?

Um, yeah...and fuck YOU, too. 

Besides the indie clones, though, this place is pretty sweet. Affordable prices and a small stage for live underground music are always a fine mix. Keep your hipster gag reflex under control and you should have no problems.
author: John G.

description: This place gets some pretty good bands. I wish that the space was a bit bigger. It can get pretty packed and hard to see the bands that are playing. The drinks are normally priced and everyone that shows up are usually pretty chill people.
author: Kate D.

description:
Had a great time here on a recent rainy Tuesday for KUSF's happy hour.  They have Racer 5 on tap, along with a really great selection of other beers, including an excellent selection of the cheap 'n' dirty variety.  I felt super comfortable there. It has a run-down but clean feel, and good random decor, with all these little dark nooks -- good if you like to sequester yourself with your drinking pals.  The bar is made of old-fashioned wood like I like, nice and long in case you feel like being part of the action.  

The 'tender was super laid back, but not remiss at all.  He opened the mason jar of corn likker for me to taste (Soooo gross!  Smells like tequila, tastes like corn oil.  But oddly smooth... So I finished the shot, naturally.) just 'cause I was curious (or maybe just 'cause of the growing pile of ones at our end of the bar).  

We meant to stay maybe 2 hours, ended up staying a full 4.  The availability of great drunk-people food in all directions is also a plus.

I mean to return, and the Bingo sounds like it might be similar to the Cacophony Society one I used to love.  Hell, I love any Bingo, so you can bet I'll make it one day...
author: Teal H.

description:
Look out weekend cus here I come, because weekends were made 4 fun! And on the weekends I'm lookin for a DANCERIA! 

Ey, It's all about BOOTY BASEMENT NIGHTS! 
The gots: 
Debbie Deb
Dr. Dre n Snoop
Shit even Mama Old Skool hits
DOWN! 
All that was missing was some Zapp n Roger

*The only thing is the dance floo is not big enuff for me--ey man push those tables back!*
author: Roxane P.

description:
Nothing says "party" like the Knockout.  Many a night I have spent here, flirting with tall skinny boys in tight jeans, luring them into the photo booth for a taste of my frothy beer.  Yes, my seduction tool of choice - the photo booth.  I'll post pictures of some of my finer catches in the near future.  Maybe I'll even make a collage!
The girls at work are all jealous because I can rock a gold lame bra and snag emo boys like nobody's business.  And the Knockout is my bar of choice!  Long live donut parties!
author: Kelly C.

description: This has got to be my favorite bar in the city.  Located on the intersection of Mission and Valencia, it's pretty hard for this place to escape the hipster inevitability of it's visitors.  It totally adds to the atmosphere of the environment and is a nice reflection of the character of the neighborhood.  On any given night they always seem to have a fun theme (hello, bingo and board games? hip hop? Smithfits?)  or kick ass live band playing.  This is one place you definately do NOT want to pass up.
author: Marilyn R.

description:
What?? This place has a photo booth and Thursday night bingo? Nice!
I was browned-out when I got here, but I do remember the bartender being super friendly... The drinks were poured stiff and the shots were free (or, who paid for my shots?) Anyway, It would be worth going back here to see if I had as much fun as I think I did.
author: Carrie D.

description:
Damn, boy.  Why u gotta be so far away?  You know I wanna holler at you, but I'm not trying to drop 20 on a cab just making it to ya crib.  I miss ya fine ass cocktails and photobooth.

EDIT  6/8/07

Dayum.  I can't believe I gave the Knockout 2 stars.  I'm such a whore.  I believe in giving updates on places, so let's talk about Knocking oneself Out.  I came here to lower my rating of the Knockout because the place, quite frankly, has gotten too popular for its own good.  I'm sick of the attitude I get at the door here when paying a cover.  But at the same time, it's good enough that lately I end up here once a week.  That's right.  I cross fucking town to come here.  So I'll up its rating a star.  But one thing that bugs me is when it's a coke whore night here.  There's only one stall, ladies.  Take a cue from the Arrow (RIP) and just do it by the vanity.  Some of us need to pee!!
author: Coco D.

description:
OK all this hipster talk--try being a 40-something lesbian who, yes, looks like a lesbian, and lives in the Mission. I still walk right into these "hipster" bars and have a great time. First, I smile politely at the guy at the door who wants to see my ID, and I just tell him DJ Chaperon is here--I never show my ID. 

My first experience was when the place was the Odeon, and I did not live in the hood. A friend was visiting from Leeds so we had a great dinner at Blue Plate; then we wanted to have a drink. My gf being a bit buzzed tried to get into Lucita's--well, since we were not working girls--that did not work out--they must of been having a private party. So next nearest bar was the Odeon. We walked in  and a duo was on stage. The lead singer was playing the stand up bass and singing Old School, Honky Tonk, country and western tunes with a very thick Japanese accent--I was in heaven. Much to my friend's delighted surprise and my gf's obvious chagrin--I knew every word to every song--scary but true. Yes, I have red neck genealogy straight from the Ozarks. The evening was a unexpected surprise for us all. 

Second time I walked into the Knockout it was for a quick beer; people were nice, beer was cheap and cold, and no one tried to speak to me in Hip-slang. So do not be afraid; it is a cool place to go even if you a girl like me.
author: Deborah S.

description:
SUSHI on wednesdays is awesome.   We are picky, and these guys bring it for real.  Just get there early for a table. $2 Kirin Ichibans, and $6 for A Kick-ass margarita feat. Fresh squeezed lime juice.  Good service, fun crowd. Dj spinning 45's...even cooler.
Looking forward to more times there.
author: Rick H.

description:
Wednesday night sushi = awesome, +five stars!  The number of hipsters in suede vests and keds that I had to deal with to get the sushi, -one star.  

Roving sushi at a bar is an awesome idea.  It was easy, delicious and affordable (especially when the BF pays for it).

I would definitely go back - I had the full intent to use the photo booth but some how got distracted and left before I did (probably b/c the number of hipsters were increasing by the truck loads).
author: Brittney B.

description:
Wicked place. Just moved to the area and it is the only place I've found worth going to.

Went to the International Club(which had lovely bartenders-coolios but the place was chock full of lecherous Latino blokes ,all vying for the bartenders attention) and another Latino bar on Mission that I didn't get.
The latter had a gender mixed crowd which is better than the last one but it was weird to say the least. We get in there after an interrogation by the midget security folks and go to the bar.

 The bartender is all smiles and shakes my hand.
(thats cool-i say to myself, friendly folks)
I order a  gin&soda for $8 and gave her a $1 tip. 
(Ok, its a little pricey but hell i'm alittle toasted so i let it slide and start to mingle at the bar)

10 mins later the lady comes back and says "Excuse me thats $2 tip not $1", not in a mean, intimidating  way but in a very nonchalant friendly manner.
(Knee Jerk reaction =hand her another dollar and smile, 'when in Rome')
....1min later...internal monologue....wait a minute WHAT IN THE MONKEY BUTT JUST HAPPENED?!? I 've never heard that before, that's not even a tip, that's like a payment  but in 3 parts : a advance, a deposit and last months rent. So it came up to be a $10 drink.
Till this day, i do not know what kind of place it was but i can assure you, it was shady.

Then we ended up at  the Knockout Room and had the same drink for $4 and a belly of laughs.

Yes luvya Knockout
author: Tak H.

description:
Although it was raining in the city, a quick walk through the Mission to Knockout on a Thursday night was perfect for my friends and I who were just looking to chill out for the night.  Thursday night Bingo comes equipped with a Bingo Mistress, a free drink ticket and a table with a plethora of wonderful prizes.  After plenty of drinks ... by the end of the night we walked away home as big bingo winners and had enough bingo cards to prove it!  We didn't walk home empty handed but straggled home with a potted plant, plastic neon fun sunglasses that would have been found at any 6 year old birthday party, a jar of delicious finger-sized pickles and a 6oz. can of mushrooms.  

There was never a line for the girls bathroom, drinks were good, and the bartender was super friendly.  And who doesn't love live music?!

You got to love this place.
author: Christina C.

description:
Who the fuck doesn't love a photo booth?

We went in like six times last night. Good times. Never gets old, except when you run out of $.
author: Audrey K.

description:
If I were a townie & a drunk & I lived in the deep Mission or Bernal Heights, you bet your ass I'd be here every night.

I was there last night (Tuesday) for a friend's show, & first impression is that I like pretty much everything about the Knockout. It's an obvious dive, they've got cheap drinks, a photobooth, pool table, pac-man, booths for people to sit in, awesome paraphernalia on  the walls, & it's very roomy.

Nevermind the extremely drunk creepy dude hitting on two of my friends all night. That's just Roger.

Okay so I don't know his name, & there's no excuse for that, but being that The Knockout is the perfect townie bar, he was probably buds with the bartender & it's known to the regulars that skeeziness is his M.O.

Great place.
author: Pete J.

description:
Don't let the talk of the hipsters scare you away from this great bar. The Tamale Lady-Equivalent of the 'sushi guy' is there on Wednesdays for happy hour which, as disgusting as that may sound, is a very, very good thing.

I've never won big at bingo on Thursdays, but have gotten drunk enough to lose track of the six scorecards in front of me. 

I've been there for a Friday/Saturday night band and those are the nights I would like to avoid most. Having said that, it's still a blast.
author: Ben R.

description:
For some reason lately this has been my defacto bar when in the Mission and I love it. They have a really awesome Oldies night, photo booth, and photo hunt (which is a rare combo). I also find their bartenders really nice and drink selection cheap and good. You can't go wrong with a tall boy of Tecate or their alcoholic root beer float. 

It is also a great small venue to see some great bands play at. I saw Glass Candy here on New Years Eve and it was amazing.
author: Katie M.

description: Went to the Knockout on their Hip-Hop night on a Saturday and loved it!  Was referred to go there for their oldies night but didn't make it and we thought it was a little sketchy because of their sign, but as soon as we walked in it was great!  Loved it!  Great food, reasonably priced drinks and friendly people.  Definitely, making a stop here every time we're in SanFran.
author: Toni Z.

description:
A casual environment and a nice performance stage/area. I recently came here to see the Young Offenders on a Tuesday night and it was fucking awesome. The place got pretty crowded but not packed.

I don't drink so I can't gauge that aspect of it, but my friends that do drink were having a great time, and they're broke, so it can't be too hard on the wallet.

Definitely a cool place.
author: Alex C.

description:
Great location for me (stumbling distance to and fro)

I always seem to have a good time here - they book lots of bands which is cool as there are fewer places to play in the City these days.

dX is a great guy - he booked my ukulele act there a couple of years ago based simply on my pitch (Dark Side of the Moon on ukuleles).... He gave us a Sat night and the whole thing was such a blast we did it again for the Knockout's 2 yr anniversary.

The Tatamimats are forever grateful!
author: Mike S.

description:
If there is a Map for revolutionaries, instigators, booty-shakers, or people who want to create community through good beverages, good people, and good music, then Knockout is the place for you.

Knockout is the home for artistas, wanderers, and good spirits. After I attend a rally, or cook a huge meal for protestors, or my familia, I go to the Knockout to hang out with people who don't believe in petty hierarchies, and appreciate Bingo and Karaoke and Rockabilly and good Latin House. If these nights were names for political parties, I would join them because that is what political party should do more of, PARTY!

DX is the best bartender in the City. He is understanding of musical and political history is above all. 

Y la Tamale Lady's recipes are to die for. She is a true revolutionary cocinera! 

Whenever I leave San Francisco for too long, I go back to Knockout and know that I am home.
author: mero cocinero k.

description:
Last night was my first time going to this place. 
Actually... it was the first time in that part of the Mission area.. it's nice! 

I went to go see the Scratchies play they're last show. I'm bummed!!


Not a bad walk from BART and a few buses run right outside the door. Makes it easy for us non-drivers, non-bikers, too-poor-to-cab-it's to get to. 

They had a special drink list that everything was $5. I tried the "extreme Limeade". I was pleasantly surprised that it was good! great! fantastic. 

This place reminds me of the punk scene before everyone was covered in piercings and tattoos and wearing Chucks.  I didn't feel judged or stared at, which is hard to find when you're a woman wearing a neon zebra print shirt and have tattoo sleeves.

My only complaint was that it was hot as balls in there. it wasn't crowded, but I still felt like I was in a sauna.
author: Towanda S.

description:
Headed to a 90's hiphop dance show that night only to find that the club was a little too over packed on the dance floor where you really could not show off any extreme moves to the mediocre jams that they played. The cost to enter was $5 and I kind of wish that it was free. 
If you are up for grind dancing with a loud DJ who keep singing over the songs, then this is your place to be! 
In my honest opinion, this isn't my cup of tea, but I know many of you might actually like to be reproducing on the dance floor!
author: Jon-o G.

description:
The first time I came here I stumbled in, unknowingly, with a college buddy who had friends bartending. Needless to say, I left even more elated than when I arrived. 

The second time I visited, I was dining across the street and someone suggested to grab a quick beer. "A" quick beer it was not. We stayed most of the night, drinking, dancing, playing video games, taking photos in the photo booth, and jamming to the tight sounds from King City. This place rawks even more because my buddy who recently got engaged, has found his wedding reception band. That band is King City. We'll see what his fiance says ... 

The bartenders pour awesome drinks. When I say awesome, I mean heavy, just the way that I like it. The entertainment is clearly there (btw, Thursday nights are Bingo night. The prize? More free beer!), and the best part is that Taqueria Cancun is right next door for drunk munchies.

The reason why this place doesn't get 5 stars is because it's impossible to get a cab from here. It's location is where Valencia meets Mission, and both times I've stumbled out the doors I've had to wait. And wait. And then call Yellow Cab. And wait. And then someone got dropped off at Taqueria Cancun and I jumped in their cab.
author: Justin V.

description:
Drinks are cheap, some are very original and good, not overly crowded (although it could be very busy with band shows and such), and show cover isn't too expensive either.  Bathroom always has plenty toilet paper, and it's relatively clean compared to other bars.

Parking isn't too hard, they always have fun events like 60s DJ dance night, good band shows, tons of restaurants nearby, and bartenders are friendly.

I love The Knockout.
author: Yoko S.

description:
I really should have come here a lot sooner.

Tonight they played early 90s rock -- she's a keeper.

Also, there was a gnarly fight outside after last call.
author: Amy Z.

description: It's getting HOT in here! No really it's HOT as HELL!! Went to my 1st booty basement and we danced our booty off but it was CRAZY HOT! Everyone was literally soaked in their sweat and it was gross accidently bumping into a stranger's wet body. I think I lost 5lbs of sweat. The music was ok and the videos of bouncing asses were hillarious
author: Karen T.

description: Had a blast with Naked and Shameless. Easy to get to on the Van ness bus. Beer good price
author: Chelsy W.

description:
Yes....I like this place.  I've been there a few times now and I always feel like I'm returning to my own dark little cave.  It's cozy!

I highly recommend BINGO Thursdays but I don't really want more freakin' hip kids to come on over, so....I am conflicted.  I've won TWICE and it's always like a huge joy, you get a $4 drink ticket in addition to your fabulous and authentic $1.99 pirate kit or sketch pad.  They have Hamm's which is like a big deal to some people but I think it tastes like it ran off of someone's boot.

The bartenders are pretty nice and really, that pretty much makes the place for me.
author: Katherine P.

description:
The Knockout Rocks!  Any bar with a drink called "big ass margarita" is cool by me.  Thursday Bingo is silly and fun.  With each drink, you get another card - sitting at the bar, watching your three cards like a hawk - how can you beat this?.  

Eat at Emmy's and then head to The Knockout.  Afterall, Thursday IS the new Friday.

:-)
author: Annie C.

description:
5 stars for the AMAZING Burning Brides show and the good time I had at the Knockout.  This is how a bar should be: trashy, loud rock and roll, sweet as pie girl bartenders that smile and give you a good pour and don't ignore girls at the bar, and lots of hot rock and roll boys that aren't shy about checking you out.  *sigh*  GOOD TIMES. 

Oh yeah, there are some little things which annoyed me, like its location in Nowhere, Bumblefuck but it is not a deal breaker.  (And I have a suspicion that its location is what makes it so great--perhaps people that bring down a party don't like to travel.) I almost do not want to go back just in case I dreamed this placed up and/or I have a bad night there and get disillusioned.

Knockout--you make my dirty rock and roll lovin' heart go pitter-pat.  If I had a locker, I'd put your picture in it.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
Live music, 60's dance parties, Chimay, Thursday bingo, karaoke with a phenomenal song selection on Mondays, plus a photo booth... what's not to love about the Knockout?

Nope. I can't think of anything either.
author: Missy C.

description:
This place is great and has a photo booth.

I'm definitely a fan.
author: Jackie G.

description:
1. Photo Booth
2. Dirty Rock and Roll
3. Pool Table/Dance Floor
4. DX
5. A million different places to sit depending on your mood

The only negative about this place is sometimes the music is too loud and too eclectic. Unlike the Hemlock, which is pretty consistent musically (but not with their pours, so much), you get either Oldies, Rockabilly, Garage, or Bart Davenport. I like it all, but some of it I need to prepare for first, you know?
author: Molly A.

description: I have been to the Knockout on quite a few occasions. It has always been a reasonable dive bar complete with good DJ's and live bands. Now the bands and DJ's are still there and still enjoyable. While the bartenders are quite lacking and the prices have just been raised. The older bartender with the pony tail is capable, quick, and proficient. The best they have. The remaining bartenders are in varying degrees worse than he. From not caring, to just downright incapable. Also at a dive bar I expect my drinks to be cheap and strong. Well not so much. I am not going to go to a dive bar where I get attitude from the bartenders to get a very poor Rusty Nail for $7. I am writing the Knockout out of my will and out of my establishments to visit. When in the area, go to El Rio or Argus, the Knockout just fails.
author: Christopher N.

description:
Debutante at the Knockout: Every Wednesday, 5/3 featured the Dilettantes

Great venue for live music and good spirits. The "Detox special" of the night consisted of Tequila and OJ. Stings a little at first, due to the quality of the tequila being poured, but after a while its quite refreshing. They also have a very good selection of other spirits including Sake and an Alcohol drenched "Root Beer Float". The beer selection is impressive as well. If that wasn't enough they also offer Trivia on Wednesday nights and Bingo on Thursday nights. I thought the size of the room might be confining to The Dilettantes sound, but they actually sounded very good in the intimate setting. The venue is a little out of the way (for me), but its definitely worth the trip to see some good, unsigned bands...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
90's night is a very underrated theme. 
Wear flannel, and you get in for free. 
I sang my little heart out to Annie Lennox songs.
Unpretentious, cheap GOOD drinks, and a jolly good crowd. 
They have photobooths too.
author: Shereen R.

description:
This is quickly becoming one of my favorite hang out spots! There is always something fun going on at the Knock Out! Godzuky Sushi serves sushi there on Wednesday nights, it's delicious and cheap!! You can wash it down with $2 Sapporo. Bingo night (every Thurs) is a bit crowded but super fun nonetheless. On the second Friday of the month they have oldies night. The dj plays nothing but rare -yet hot- 45's that you can totally dance your pants off.

If you are in the mood for something sweet yet strong, try the root beer float!
author: Javier B.

description: Dropped in to see a friend's band play and really enjoyed this skinny little bar. It wasn't conspicuously hipster, more of the uncool-cool ethos. Or maybe just because it was Daniel Johnston tribute night, so people played it down just in honor of him. Anyhow, a feel goody sort of neighborhood bar, pleasant and friendly with reasonably priced drinks (a large nigiri sake for $8, $4 for a bass and $5 for a margarita, among others). Plenty of TV screens about, that night playing the Devil and Daniel Johnston, natch. Great music in between sets too (lotsa british invasion plus one of my favorite nuggets (run, run run by the gestures).
author: Henry Y.

description:
I finally went to the Knockout for ska night last Saturday, and I must say, it's a fairly lovable dive.  The $5 cover charge I could've done without, but the cheap, cheap drinks more than make up for it.  I had a modified version of their famous 'Hammjob' (a can of Hamm's and a shot of Kentucky Reserve for $5) by substituting Dewar's for an extra $2.  I had a couple more sets throughout the night, and each shot was filled to the rim of the glass.  Thanks, fellas.  

Points lost because of the awkward layout which traps a shitload of people in a narrow pathway against the bar.  Our friends ended up hanging out in the coat closet, as it was the only place you could stand without rubbing elbows with strangers.  And the $5 cover to listen to some guy play ska and reggae music?  My roommate can do that for free at my house.  In fact, come over some time, I'll give you a discount on drinks.  Also, I'm not sure which bar is a popular hangout for cute girls, but this isn't it.  Come here when you want to get ridiculously drunk with your guy friends and not have to worry about paying a lot or hitting on anybody.  It's perfect!
author: Kyle O.

description:
I enjoy attending Thursday night BINGO at The Knockout with my labmates, if only for the reason that I derive pleasure from helping to lower the hipster/science nerd ratio of the bar.

Personal vendettas aside, this place offers stiff libations, a photobooth in which to get your pose on, good music, computerized solitaire, and large, clean surroundings. God, I just realized that commenting on hygiene makes me sound like an old geezer *denture falls out of mouth*.

*Now lower denture falls out as well*.

If hunger seizes you before, during, or after your scheduled drinking session, Taqueria Cancun's delicious tacos await you two doors down.
author: Momo R.

description:
I only go here for bingo, otherwise the Knockout is a bit too hip for my tastes.  The bingo allows (forces?) the hip kids to take off their veneer of cool indifference and shout along with the drunken masses "BEEEEEE SIIIIX!!!!"

This makes me happy.

That and my Virgin Mary night light that I won a few months back.  

She lights the way.
author: Mat K.

description:
Get thee to the Knockout! John is fun to work with (if you are booking shows) and they're working hard to make a go of it. Great shows and Bingo from the former Sadie's crew is the hot ticket here. 
Not easy being in the neverland part of the Mission, but it's so much more relaxing than the 16th St corridor.
Dustin now works there Weds, he's  a peach! They have sushi happy hour with Sake specials and Clare has an 'annual prom' in July!
author: Colleen B.

description:
DONUT PARTY rocks my socks. 

I stumble into this Mission bar, 3 martinis to the wind. A friend suggested we go here and we are "on the list". I guess the "list" happens to be a Donut with sprinkles. I grabbed a button and a hand-stamp and moved on. 

What I encountered was some of the best music I have heard live since...ok I havent heard anything live like this shit before. I was coherent long enough to hear Miyami (minimal synth electro) and white jumpsuit-clad Tussle (drum-heavy electro pop). Loopy and yacked out of commision, I couldnt help but be mezmerized by this beautiful electronic ear-sex. This party IS just like a donut. Sweet, fluffy, well rounded and leaves you wanting more.
author: K K.

description:
I went here on a Sunday night to see my friend's band playing. The place was pretty cool, a regular hipster bar but I don't really mind. The drinks were very reasonable. They serve the old school beer, Hamms.  Hamms+a shot of Jim Beams=$5. That's awesome!

They also have a lot of fancy drinks but in the place like this, make me feel like a fool to order one. Ha! I got gin&tonic. It was only $4 and the glass was definitely bigger than most bars I went to, so I was happy as a clam =)

They have photobooth! I love places with photobooth though didn't get a chance to take one. I definitely have to come back though it's kinda out of my way. Ah, I wish you were a little bit closer to me =(
author: Perry S.

description:
I love this place!  I've only been there twice.  Drinks are reasonably priced, there's a pool table that never seems to have a long line, kewl random videos screening, a photo booth, and good music of a mixed variety is always playing.  The staff was incredibly nice (even after my friend shattered a martini glass...thank you for not kicking us out!)

Also, I highly recommend the Doo Wop Night...sounds cheesy, but loads of fun.
author: Lyz L.

description:
My band played here last month.  We really loved the ambiance -- christmas lights and red walls!  What what!  Plus there's a photo booth, Ms. Pacman, and bizarre movies playing on a few tvs.  Nothin' says fun like old-school godzilla.  AND they did some really cool chalk art promoting our show on the chalkboard outside in a pseudo-tattoo font.

We'll be back.
author: Veggie J.

description:
B-I-N-G-O
forget what you think you know
about bingo, yo

And Hamm's.
author: Sam W.

description: One of the cooler bars in the city. It's not full of pricks, which is an automatic 3 stars in the city, the drinks are par for the course and it does get crowded, but it's not constantly crowded at the level you'll suffocate there. Always had a good time.
author: Keith B.

description:
After a second visit to Knockout last night, I'm ready to say I'm a fan ...

From great events like Thursday night Bingo (complete with the most old-school bingo cards around, and a visit from the Tamale lady), to great live music (on my first visit I saw Sean Hayes in this tiny club for only a $5 cover), to a great selection of beers ... this is quickly becoming one of my favorite neighborhood spots.
author: Kevin S.

description:
I'll keep it short as there's already 100 reviews of this place, but how can you not love a bar that: 

a) has bingo 
b) serves cans of Hamm's beer

From the Land of Sky Blue Waters (Waters), 
From the land of pines, lofty balsam, 
Comes the beer refreshing, 
Hamm's the Beer Refreshing, 
Haaaaamms.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Dude.  Bingo.  I haven't played in years and there I was rocking five or six cards at once.  I'm not even sure how many, all I know is that you get a card every time you buy a beer, hence the confusion.  

Plus everyone loves photobooths and being the nerd I am I was stoked that this one is real color prints, not that crappy digital shit.

We stayed after bingo as the tunes were really great.

I think I have a new thursday night routine.
author: Rachel N.

description:
It is definitely an issue of what night.  I go zero nights.  Unless a friend is playing.  Trevor, TLG, and the like are there from time to time... at least back in the day.  It holds a lot of good memories.. like the night we boarded the party bus to the TLG show in SC at Moe's.

The KnockOut is a fine little bar.... with superb memories.  Minus two for the too hip for me people that were sort of... boring... and silently judging me.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
I really like this place and have ended up going there quite a bit recently. Can't say I love their choices in bands that they have there all the time, but the people that go there, bartenders, and atmosphere are all fun. They also have what might be one of the better drink deals in the city all the time: 22oz. Tiger Bombers for 5$. They don't advertise it, but they're there. Waiting for you and calling to you behind the bar.

I also like the $1 Oyster Nights that the do too. High quality food for a happy hour deal!
author: Matt C.

description:
I might actually give this fine bar Five Stars, except (when it was the Odeon) they used to do karaoke here. And it was always a car crash. Good times. They called it Costume Karaoke and would trot out 4 or 5 tubs of skanky burning man costumes and make you put one on before you sang. Stay away from furry things or onesies and you were usually OK. I'd always just grab the Dracula cape. The KJ was super hott too.

Now they have better DJs here and Smile is on Mondays and I know all you BM-ers really, really miss the Odeon but it's time to move on. Start your own bar for the one month a year you aren't preparing for or returning from BM.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Probably my favorite bar in SF. A nice long walk from Valencia & 16th - needed after the first couple rounds of pounding. Pint margaritas (substitute Cazadores for the well, which they never seem to charge me for), pool, band, characters, etc.

Great spot. Not much in the way of trim usually, but alas I am retired from skirt chasing.

Bus ride back to 24th then down Mission. A fantastic loop full of rewarding experiences ; )
author: Brandon M.

description:
I like the Knockout... Its stylish yet unsophisticated.

To be honest, I don't remember this place too well. From what I DO remember its your run of the mill San Francisco bar... I think they had the same decorator that they used over at Kilowatt!

What I will say about this place:

I was there with some buddies drinking Heineken (for some reason) when one of my afore-mentioned buddies drops and shatters his beer on the ground. Oh shit. Well, lets see how the bar staff handle this... So I tell the bar back, he gets a little pissy look on his face, and then starts to clean it up. As soon as he's done, another friend drops & shatters his beer. They weren't that drunk, just that stupid. The guy kept his cool and cleaned up without kicking us out. That paired with their drink prices earns them a 4 star review!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Coming from a musicians perspective, I think this place is lame.  My band has played there twice and there has always been shitty sound.  The location of the stage is super shitty also.  The whole set up is awkward.  What this place really needs is to tear down the partition that separate the bar and tables, that would open it up.  

From a patrons point of view, it's cool.  Too many hipsters for my taste though.
author: Larry A.

description:
Just the BEST bar to ever open in SF!
You can't go wrong with what ever is happening here!
Make sure you check out Shuckin and Jivin on the first Sunday
of the month!
dX the bartender/DJ rocks!!
And try the Root Beer float, it's great and you'll be on the floor before you know it!
author: O. S.

description:
Kick-Ass karaoke on Monday's for "Happy Hour" with a great KJ who has some very cool song list.  I saw songs on his list you just don't see anywhere else.  Cheap but well made drinks.  Live Music.  Great crowd.  What the hell else can you ask for?

Hit it, but don't quit it!!!
author: Scott A.

description: I went to Friday Teenage Dance craze and drunken freestyled with a bunch of Mission kids to R Kelly's "Trapped in the Closet Part 1." Excellent.
author: Alex H.

description:
1 star bingo
1 star decor and cheese elevator tunes
1 star for pin ups in restroom
1 star for ass hole bartender
4 stars for a good time
author: Porfirio R.

description:
I love unknown awesomeness.  I checked out this really awesome dynamic trio that go by the name "My First Earthquake" at the Knockout tonight...

Lemme break it down for you:  awesome people.  great acts.  a little steamy and warm inside, but hey, you're looking for steamy and warm. This place is definitely the look.  And 'My First Earthquake" was a-mazing.


Plus one for really awesome music.  Plus one for taking a chance on unknown acts that rock.  Plus one for amazing people.  Plus one for reasonable drink prices.  Plus one for the other Bartosz I met.  Minus one for not throwing the drunk guy out that was kissing on the lead singer's mom.

WOo!
author: Bartosz S.

description:
This is a great place for music and now burlesque.  It's relaxed and friendly.  The sound is good for such a tiny place.  The photo  booth is cool.

I've never had a drink here, I've only gone as a photographer and I don't drink and shoot.  The drinks look good, the tequila selection looks too small to interest me in showing up just to drink.
author: Spike S.

description: Teenage Dance Craze and Oldies Nights are my absolute dance nights in San Francisco. There's such a great vibe and everyone is so nice out on the dance floor. Cover is only $2 before 11 and $4 after that but with such amazing tunes, why show up late and miss out on half the set?
author: Clarissa S.

description: Maybe I had another life in the sixties, but I LOVE Teenage Dance Craze. I had so much fun and danced with so many people that were just there to shake it and drink Tecate tallboys. I think these kinds of nights make for more fun, cause it seems more genuine you know--you're not a$s-grinding someone in the Marina or worrying too much about anyone else.
author: Krystha B.

description:
Bar Bingo - need I say more

(wish it were back at Sadie's though)
author: melissa g.

description:
THURSDAY NIGHT BINGO***** I'm drunk and havin' a blast!

Friendly patrons and strong/cheap drinks...  great bar!
The only bummer was how dirty my glass of whiskey was.  I'm NOT a snob...  Usually the drink has got to have a floatie the size of a seamonkey or be covered in blood (somebody else's) before I care, but for real!  Every glass that the bartender pulled to replace the glass in question was dirtier than the one before...  finally I reached across the bar and grabbed a plastic cup, and said, "Fuck it!   Let's play some damn BINGO!!!"  And I never got to yell "BINGO" again, but still had a blast, especially after the Tecate double-tall-tallboy!
author: Erica S.

description:
Hipster bar at its finest, atlho not being located too close to the main concentration of hipster mission bars keeps a lot of the riff raff out.

Im not a hipster, but I fit in fine here. There is a little bit of a 'tude present, but fight 'tude with 'tude and youll be ok.

Every night hosts something different: sushi, bingo, karaoke, plain ol' local band. Also included: photo booth and a table top video game.

As for drinks--they range from bar specialties like "Man Berry" -- dont know what was in it, but damn it was strong. And of course, the cheapest beer available (we asked) -- Hamm's. So gross, but so satisfying. Oh Hamm's...from the land of sky blue waters.
author: Sabine S.

description:
I don't like many bars in SF.  I don't like even thinking about what I am going to wear when I go to an establishment of this kind, and the hipster stare seems to be ubitquitous. 
However, I really like this bar.  I like to sit in their chairs.  I like to listen to their music.  I like to take pictures in their booth.  I like their manberry drink.  And one time I went there and they were playing Scarface, sans sound, on a huge screen.  What could be better?
author: Rhea S.

description:
I've been to the Knockout once before on a Saturday afternoon a couple months back. My only recollection of the place was having too many beers, playing a lot of pool and then, as day turned into night, someone offering me a warm, fresh donut. At the time, I had no idea what to make of it but I welcomed the nourishment and washed it down with a beer -delicious, huh? About the same time I finished my donut dinner, a band called the Donuts Disco (classic disco, mutant disco, italo, cosmic, dutch electro old school hip hop and house) took the stage. 

This time I made my way through the Knockout's dark doorway and wondered how my evening would compare to last time. And, well, it ended up about the same. 

For more check out www.missiononmission.com
author: Gadiel M.

description:
Went to the Knockout for an Oldies dance party (Soul, Doo-Wop, R&B Girl Bands) on Friday night. The music was fantastic, bartenders and crowd very friendly. They have a lot of specialty drinks and $2 Hamms, High Life and Coronitas. A girl on a budget can't afford to be picky so Hamm's it is. The best part, other than the awesome tunes and dancing was the PHOTOBOOTH!!! The sis and I love a good romp in those little boxes, I think we went in about 4 times. That's 4 less Hamm's but at least I have something to show for it other than a wicked hangover.
The only downside to this place (for me) is the location. Long way from home but definitely worth the cab fare once in awhile. Knockout beware, we will be back!
author: deb C.

description:
This is the perfect place to go if you need a drink after work, 
want to watch movies about people hanging out with fucking
dolphins for a year, meet some weirdos, get drunk, realize 
the burrito place next door is closed so you can't get your fix,
freak out, have a cigarette, watch the lead singer and the 
drummer of the band that just finished have a lover's quarrel
while loading their equipment into their van, go back inside,
use the men's bathroom (because women's is flooded, again)
and spend the rest of your night drinking the lame west coast
version of PBR: Hamm's. (Now, I don't care if it is from the 
land of sky blue waters - it didn't win a blue ribbon so it's crap
to me.  On the other hand, i'd rather punch myself in the fucking
face than drink an Tecate so Hamm's it is.)

Ps. the bro-seff is a gay drink but then again so is SF, so way 
to go, Knockout.
author: kates d.

description: Didn't let my friend in with her ID, but hosts punk shows so an A+ there.
author: Natalie M.

description: I was wasted watching an amazing punk show a week or so ago, apparently I was here!  I really just wanted to see my friend's band so can't remember too much about the place.  Dingy and dark, good sound system, lots of drinks.  The end.
author: Brian G.

description: I was diggin Oldies Night in a real way, but as the tracks wore on, I realized: this DJ seems to be playing obscure just for the sake of being obscure. I get a minor kick out of the ludicrous lyrics of tunes like "Hippy Hippy Shake" and "Tiny Tim," but there's only so much most people can take, right? The silly needs to mingle with the just-plain-good. But, no Exciters, DJ says. Maybe I left too early for the Ronettes, Smokey, etc. I hear Teenage Dance Craze has that spoonfull to help the rest go down.
author: Jena H.

description:
i've been here upon waits for restaurants across the road.  the bar is dressed with great posters and signs, and the drinks are stiff and generous.

many times i've seen the listings for this place in the guardian or sf weekly, and the music seems to be up my dancing alley.   i've never made it out here to shake my tail feather, but i will have the knockout in mind for the future.
author: Sheri N.

description: Love love love this place. Came here for Bingo Thursdays and it was a hoot. Tina BINGO'd once and won a free drink and some smarties. We went to Cancun next door and ate a big heaping wet burrito while drinking tall Tecates. My only slight gripe is the drink prices. For a dive bar this far out, you shouldn't be paying $5 for tall boys.
author: Rich B.

description: Debaser = the most fun I've had at a bar since I turned 21.  In 1997.
author: Cory G.

description: The first things I noticed while waiting for my beer was that an old Clint Eastwood western was being projected on to the wall and they have a photo-booth. I was equally enthralled by both. Those were the bonuses! Along with great beers on tap, top shelf liquors, a video game system (choice of Frogger, Ms. Pac Man, Donkey Kong, and Galaga), a pool table, there was a band playing. The band was really wasn't that good, but it was drowning out the drunk telling me how much better his margarita mix is at home. Who orders margaritas at a dive bar anyways??? Cash bar only which doesn't make sense in modern society and it is the Mission therefore parking is atrocious.
author: Bucky K.

description:
i don't think i've ever seen so many fashonistia revisionist hippie new wavers in my life, really. 

& it was pretty scary. especially when multiplied over again exponentially because one of them was doing a particularly insane coked out looking dance. kind of pigeonesque, actually.

however, it's got some good shit going for it. like...
-booking my bf's band there on monday.
-cute bartender lady making extra strong drinks.
-super cool & snazzy decor & lighting.
- big ol' video screens.
-being warm when it's freezing outside (maybe not so good in the summer).
-& a photobooth. a motherfuckin' photobooth! hooray!
author: Irene S.

description: My favorite bar in the bay area. Good DJ's (old soul, garage, brit pop, brit invasion). Great bands on almost any night. Fantastic bartenders, good strong pours. Photo booth, what else do you need.
author: Ben A.

description: I have done some unspeakable things at this bar. And by that I mean far more unspeakable than you might imagine. I owe it to the $5 hamm + x-large shot of Whiskey. And the fact that I sneak in flasks of whiskey and no one seems to care. It's wonderful that I've yet to run into two of the three least favorite people I have ever known, inside, even though they're always here, because it's so dark. And being next door to Taqueria Cancun does not hurt either. And I really appreciate shoegaze, pychedelic, and otherwise some of the mopier musical selection that's spun here for rug-cutting.
author: Y K.

description: So this used to be the sorely missed Odeon.  Fortunately, all is not lost.  While the disturbing trend in SF sees cool, "dive" bars with real character taken over by new owners and almost invariably made into tacky, soulless nonentities (for instance, the formerly cool Hush Hush), the Knockout has potential.  In fact, I do believe that the person who used to do the booking at the formerly cool Hush Hush now does the booking at the Knockout, and I for one have seen a couple of very cool shows here.  It's still too soon for me to say, but besides the rather distant (by my standards) location, the Knockout has 5-star potential.
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description: Thursday bingo night has changed my life (or at least the way I look at drinking on work/school nights).  The photo booth is a heart-warming and bonding machine that is rarely seen nowadays- thanks Knockout for keeping it alive!  My roommate and I are still hell-bent on winning bingo (nope, still haven't yet- even with like the 7 cards we use) just for the Jesus night-light...
author: Samantha B.

description: Great neighborhood bar, makes living in Glen Park not suck so bad. Great atmosphere, nice candles, liked the art on the wall.  Silent movies and sixties soul were a superb surprise.  Wish they had a short pool stick 'cause the table's a little close to the wall.  Wish it wasn't as far away from my friends who are all too lazy to get out here.  But, that's kinda nice too, keeps the uber-scenesters at bay...
author: Jesse Lu S.

description:
thanks for the review that mentioned the crazy drinking monkey (well, the luchador, but from the cab it really does look like a drinking monkey) otherwise i would have had difficulty finding the place.

this would be "my" bar, if it weren't so far.  (i am the hip-hop-otamus, my rhymes are bottomless.)

went last night to see my friend's band (good city lie still), and i had a great time.  granted it was wednesday (and wednesday is not the new thursday which is not the new friday)  but the place was full of people supporting the local music.  very unpretentious and friendly crowd.  

nice bartender (he would serve his friends first, but if i owned a bar, i would do exactly the same thing, which made me like him even more), the door guy was holier-than-thou... but in his defense he was much holier-than-me.  

sound in the place is pretty damn decent for a small bar.  great place, i did feel at home in an instant.  maybe it was the alcatraz prisoners on the wall (a fan from childhood), the b+w photobooth, or the cindy sherman photograph right outside the ladies but i really did feel right at home.

erotic photo-hunt!  this machine is the hardest one i have come across.. with the highscore being 349,000.  crazy hard.  us (us as in the royal me and my roomie, not the US) veterans couldn't even make it on the top ten.  pathetic.

a pub crawl between zeitgeist and here would be epic awesome.
author: Ge O.

description: Went here last night, Saturday, around 10pm. Had to pay a lousy 5 bucks just to get into a bar, which I ferociously dissaprove of. Bathroom sucks, place was dirty, and it was way too crowded. Couldn't figure out why it was so packed. Anyways, next time I'll save 5 bucks, buy a few 40s, and just stay home. My house is cleaner and I don't have to hijack the boys bathroom to pee.
author: Lisa M.

description: when i first moved to sf this was the first bar I felt at home in. long bar, a little dancfloor to get your 80s dancing on, plenty of cute girls. perfectooo
author: C D.

description: The drinks and even the drink specials are decently priced, the crowd is good and so is the stage area/seating. I like the movies being played in the background (conversation pieces if nothing else). My favorite part of this bar/venue is the photo booth. Best one in SF. I'm serious! High-quality, color photos for $3.
author: Tara R.

description: booty basement had my mine shaking into the wee hours of a sunday morning. the $5 tall cans of tecate helped me stay within my budget. very hip and I absolutely love the albums on the wall. I have no idea how I would feel about it walking in here sober  on a sunday afternoon, but i'd be willing to find out!
author: Caddy M.

description: Wow.  The Knockout is pretty damn awesome.  And no, that isn't the "Manberry" talking.  Great drinks, great local feel, walking distance from home, and a Karaoke Gong Show on Sundays make this place my new favorite local bar.  Of course, I probably shouldn't be telling you this.  I should be keeping it to myself.  But whatever, we're all friends here, right?
author: Samantha W.

description:
i went last night to meet up with the wife and other fellow dogwalker friends after my boxing workout.

parking is a bitch, but it's 29th and mission, what's new?

this place is a great bar!

here are some of the great things

1) good beer selection
2) nice bar keep
3) girl comes in a plugs in her lap top to the sound system and it starts to play black lips "good bad, not evil"  http://www.myspace.com/theblacklips
4) other people at the bar were nice
5) bar keep will open bottle of the georgia corn likker and let ya have a taste for free

not really much else you could really want in a bar...
author: erik H.

description:
thursday nights is bingo! buy drink = 1 bingo play card
photo booth. pool table. stage. insane decor. dance floor.
they serve hamms. and scooby snacks. (aka coronitas)
this place is the place to go if you MUST be surrounded
by ONLY hipsters, and absolutely no marina or bridge and tunnel.
only locals and die-hard hoodies come to a place this far out.

i love this place but damn, even the JT does not wish to travel so far.

One does not simply WALK into the mission. Its black gates are guarded by more than just crackheads. There is evil there that does not sleep. And the great Eye is ever watchful. It is a barren wasteland. Riddled with fire and ash and dust. The very air you breathe is a poisonous fume. Not with ten thousand men could you do this. It is folly!
author: JT X.

description: What do you get when the owner of a cool ass bar digs music and advocates for good music? A beautiful hum...not unlike that sound you hear when you're alone in an empty car on a silent street. Just pretend it doesn't drive you mad. Just pretend you don't know what it's talking about. Just pretend you don't like it. Just pretend. Just pretend.
author: Roy M.

description:
if you're still feeling unsure of what a 'hipster' is, head over to the knockout for hipster culture 101. yelp anthropologist-in-residence, jill k., investigates...

at the knockout, you can see the hipster in his natural habitat: observing the traditional hipster way of dress, the hipster haircut/grooming methods, and you can take note of typical hipster ceremonial beverages (often includes fernet).

this is clearly a place with lots of regulars. even though i went with some friends, i still felt like an outsider. i went on a sunday night for the karaoke gong show. if you know me, you know i'm a karaoke junkie and that i love to get up and sing regardless of level of drunkness.

the way the karaoke gong show (KGS) works is that there's a panel of judges not too unlike paula/randy/simon. if you don't get gonged during your performance, the judges then rate you on a scale of 1-10. don't take them too seriously! there are definitely some inherent biases going on and they're not necessarily rating you based on skill or talent. if they're in a bad mood or have it in for you, they'll definitely rip you apart. ouchie!

nice sized place with plenty of tables, couches, a pool table, etc. friendly and attentive bartender.

i'd check it out another time if i were in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to the outer mission just to hang out here.
author: Jill M.

description: Why has no one said anything about the Odeon????  I used to go see Dr. Hal there, and they have the twisted cabaret which is always a good time.  I love the eccentricity of this place.
author: Corie W.

description: Love to dance here- racer 5 on tap is a bonus too
author: Megan M.

description: Free punk shows on tuesdays!!!!! one of the most amazing things a cool bar could do! i love this place.
author: Shon G.

description: It smells bad, the service is alright, the drinks are okay, the photobooth is...present, and the location is just outside where I can easily access. And yet, the place rules. Really, it's my favorite. Monday through Thursday, there's so few other places I'd rather be. Thursday is Bingo night, and geriatric is just alright with me. The drinks are next to free. I've never left without a conversation with someone slightly drunker than myself; Go to the Knockout.
author: Alyssa v.

description: I was at Knockout Friday, and had my iPhone, all the cash in my wallet, and my bike gloves (??) stolen out of my bag. I didn't realize until after last call when they kicked us all out, and even after begging the doorman, I was not allowed back in to look for my items, and had the door closed in my face. According to the crowd on the street who overheard, things get stolen all the time at the Knockout and the staff are notoriously rude about it. When I called them the next day to ask if they found anything they laughed at me over the phone. Do not leave anything alone for five minutes there, and don't depend on the establishment to be on your side - they're unbelievably unhelpful.
author: Light E.

description: No matter how shitfaced I got the last time I was there, no matter how many chairs I knocked over, glasses I broke, beers I spilled or people I tried to fight or fuck, the folks at Knockout always let me back in, with open arms.  I love this place.
author: slayerela b.

description: Check it! The third Saturday of the month is a DJ event called the Booty Bassment. The best hip hop records are played & mixed by ultra talented DJs Dimitri & Ryan who pack the dance floor. Gotta knock a star for the heated conditions, they have a few fans but it gets mighty hot. Plus, only one girl's bathroom stall made me miss some good songs, dammit Knockout, I still like you.
author: Amanda H.

description: Love this place.  Awesome live bands, oldies night, tecate, and a photo booth!   It doesn't get as crowded as the bars on 16th, so there's plenty of room to dance.  The men aren't aggressive here at all, so you can enjoy your drink in relative peace.  Plus, it's surrounded by late night mexican/El Salvadorean fare next door and across the street!
author: Tracy N.

description: Excellent venue and bar -- cheap drinks, AND a photobooth is all included in this lovely package deal.
author: Amanda L.

description:
don't care what kind of crowd hangs out there, it's cheap and has live music.

awesome cheap burritos next door
author: kiki b.

description: What a great bar!!  I love, love, loved the Knockout!  We got there around 9ish on a Thursday for bingo.  Next time we know, we have to get there a little bit earlier.  But we had such a blast playing.  They pour the drinks here STRONG.  The bartender had me laughing.  He was a little rough around the edges and maybe a tiny bit drunk.  But he was great and added character to the place.  Oh, and the photo booth?!!  Awesome.  I felt like I was 10 and at a carnival taking pictures in there.  Everyone was super nice and friendly.  This is a great spot and I can't wait to come back.
author: Kim C.

description: Fun dive bar... I'll probably edit this to five stars after I've gone to drunk bingo.
author: Caleb D.

description:
A friend of a friend suggested I go here when I asked where a good divey bar with good tunes I could go to. I don't know how it is on other nights, but I came here on a Saturday night and it wasn't really what I expected? I thought it was gonna be like the other bars on 16th & Valencia...

So I pay $5 at the door and enter a different scene equipped with live honky tonkin' bands and women clad in vintage 50's attire.

Okay, so I kind of expected bands, but didn't really expect (or really want to) see rockabilly bands. Suffice it to say, they were great. Very good in their craft. Everybody was boppin' around the whole night. The place was a good size. They had an intimate-sized dancefloor and a stage for the bands. Sweet photo booth (good for those drunk-o pictures that everybody loves to take of themselves). The second band I remember, The Royal Deuces, was great. The lead guy was amazing at his chicken pickin' and tremolo pickin' on the gee-tar. Everybody was really cool and I didn't feel intimidated by anybody (given that it seemed to be rockabilly night and I'm from Orange County / Los Angeles where the scene here is saturated with idiots who'll fight anything that moves). So I was very surprised and had a great time. And the best part about it was their cheap-o drinks (and their names, "The Bro-seff, Bro!" or "Absolut Manberry"). What I was extremely excited about was that they served a Vietnamese beer called Brew 33. I never even knew Vietnam had their own beer (a little ethnic pride washed over me)! 

So I'm sure that it's different every night and the night that I went shouldn't make it any different because I'm sure that there ain't no bad nights here. I'm sure you're always gonna get a great crowd with great service and great music. I will definitely visit this bar everytime I'm in town.
author: Anthony T.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! OBVI... I'm in their icon picture!!! No complaints. If you are looking to get off your butt, and have some fun...This is the place to do it!!!
author: Trump D.

description:
A favorite local watering hole. This place has been getting better and better since it changed hands a couple years back. They got rid of the pool table (thank god), and switched the stage to the other side of the room (which makes so much more sense), and started booking decent events.

Oh except for the lame punk shows that seem to happen every tuesday. On such nights I always seem to end up walking down the block to the argus, quietly cursing under my breath.

still, they have pretty much everything you'd want in a bar. dancefloor, good selection of booze, photobooth (a classic party enabler), small stage, shitty soundsystem, cocktail galaga, plenty of seating.

!LLOR SEMIT DOOG EHT LET
author: Aidan D.

description:
one of my favourite mission bars! heres why:

1. Bingo! thursdays 8pm-10pm. you get a new card with every drink you buy, so you cane get really drunk and play like 6 cards! prizes are awesome too!
2. The Broseff! the bartenders will give you a dirty look when you order this, and honestly, i think its only on the menu as a joke, but its THE BEST DRINK EVER! take one sparks in a glass, drop in one shot of citron vodka, and chug. 
3. soul night! 
4. booty basement!

gripes? no air conditioning and that place heats up like an inferno! also, soul night and booty basement generally have the longest lines ever!!! if you go, go early.
author: Jaei P.

description: This place is Awesome! Great prices and cool bartenders(especially Dusty). Every Wednesday night they have a sushi happy hour from 6 to 8 thats hosted by one of the old chefs of Tokyo Go Go. He sells rolls for $4 and nigiri $3.  Best deal in town for the quality.
author: tim a.

description:
hip hop booty shaking after some comfort food across the street? 


yes please.
author: tiff f.

description:
the knockout used to be the Odeon, a smallish bar in the outer mission right near where mission and valencia cross. the odeon used to host all these burning man events and other artsy fringe weird bizarre interesting events. but now it's gone, and in it's place is the knockout, a chill hipster-ish dive-ish bar that has that typical mission bar feel. it's a pretty cool place to kick back and have a drink, but it's pretty far out there, and definitley not as original or interesting as the bar it replaced...

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com)
author: vlad k.

description: fairly cheap drinks and bingo thursdays!  great dive.
author: dan a.

description: Atmosphere, great.  Bingo, very fun.  Beer selection, pretty damn good.  Erotic photo hunt, what can I say.  Girls that sometimes take charge of the door for rockabilly shows, they can be mean. But it's still worth it.
author: JB S.

description: I never would have discovered this place had my best friend not moved a zillion miles away.  I'm so glad she did!  Great drink specials and prices, a photo booth to capture illicit behavior real-time and a very ecclectic music schedule.  I've seem a host of rockabilliy here, and recommend you check out www.hickswithsticks.com for simliar if you like a little Americana served with a tall boy Tecate.
author: Lady Ms. K.

description: Your lucky I can drink Hamms and can enjoy the Champagne of beers. I went last night to bid a good friend farewell on his journey to litter Venezuela with children of his seed. That said, enjoyed the vibe, drank with good friends and tip my hat at the decor. KnocKOUT two Stars for paying 5 bucks to get in only to realize that had I waited 10 more minutes, entrance would have been free. The band was obnoxious. The bar keep was cool enough to sound like a strip club Dj but not enough to earn the fallen Asterisks.
author: Joe J.

description: friendly staff and stiff cheap drinks. always something going on, whether it be karaoke, bingo or a cheap show. cover is always low. awesome drink specials. can get a bit crowded and you have to smoke out front. other than those small details there isn't much reason to dislike this joint.
author: Joseph N.

description: Every Wed until 9, chef Ichi rolls his cooler into this hipster dive and makes great sushi. Delicious tuna belly.
author: chris o.

description: The Knockout is fun, comfortable and the drinks are good. Its it my favorite neighborhood bar even though I am not technically in the neighborhood. Booty Bassment is always a good time (SF or SD) but it does get a crowded and hot so turning from hipster to hoochie makes sense. Teenage dance craze is lots and lots of fun. DX has then best time spinning those records and seriously makes me want to jump back and kiss myself. Smiling, sweaty, fun.
author: kristen s.

description: I love that I can stuff my face with three carnitas tacos next door, walk over here and see a great show, drink some cheap beer (bartenders, ruling, esp the owner), take some bloated photobooth pics, then work up another round of hunger dancing to some oldies, and stumble back over to Cancun and eat more tacos. it's like a perfect sentence (albeit a run-on) punctuated by two spicy mexican quotation tacos...err, i mean marks.
author: Maris D.

description:
this was stop numero dos on a friday night, and being uninterested in the bar, i was won over by the music.  you know djs are doing an amazing job when you have no idea what song is playing but are still shakin' it.  on every song.  

it was a refreshing change of pace from other snooty, overpriced options, and the fun-lovin' group of people on the dancefloor personified their motto of "let the good times roll."  look in the mirror when you're waiting for a drink and you'll see what i mean.  but to the people from last night, leave the grandma-esque baby powder at home.  only breakdancers can claim that stuff as a dance aid.
author: Patricia D.

description: I'd like to thank the greater Yelp community for refraining from using any pun involving the phrase "knock out" in their reviews.
author: John F.

description: Dig it.  My favorite local bar.  Nice bar, funky atmosphere, good beer, great bartenders.  I've seen some great bands here, and I've seen some that make my ears bleed.  Check out Bingo Thursdays.
author: John K.

description: I like their drink specials and their bartenders are really chill. I don't really dig a lot of the people that hang out here. But they have good events and music from time to time. I wouldn't say it's my favorite bar, but I don't really have any complaints about it.
author: Annie H.

description: The vibe in this place is electric and the dance floor is insane.  I felt like I was was in a time warp, watching a dance session from the 50s.  Very San Frantastic and a hipster mecha of sorts.
author: Tony R.

description: I went here recently to see my friend's fabulously eccentric band Borts Minorts. It is a great space. Kind of divey, and comfy, but with all the amenities you might want. A pool table, photobooth (color), small stage, good bar, DJ (on Monday), and a funny crowd. I heard that it is popular with the Burning Man crowd, and all the dancers there did seem to be enjoying themselves with that Burning Man abandon. They have a great sign that I heard was drawn by one of the new owners, but I could be making that up.
author: Cyrelle D.

description: I use to frequent the Elbo Room back when DX had rockabilly bands playing every Wednesday night.  Although I miss the spaciousness of the Elbo Room, the Knockout is a close replacement.  Cheep drinks, good tunes, but not a whole lot of room to dance.
author: Rachelle H.

description:
photobooth, sit down ms. pacman arcade, and stiff drinks.

i'm really tempted to give this bar a 5 star rating: the DJs are good (pink mountaintops AND liars?  yes, please), and the interior of the bar reminds me a little bit of Wild At Heart (this bar i love in berlin).  however, it's not within stumbling home drunk distance from my flat, so 4 stars will have to do.

i heart thee, knockout.  p.s. stop booking lame bands.
author: Claudia B.

description: I've had some pretty amazingly good times here.  It's really dark and definitely on the small size.  Most of the time, I can't handle the thought of so many people squeezed into such a tiny space, but they generally play pretty great music or have a rockin' band or two.
author: Jessica T.

description: Definitely my favorite bar in the city. Great events, semi-friendly bartenders, cheap drinks, and a photobooth with exceptionally flattering lighting (my friends and I always marvel at how great we look in those photos). Only complaint is that their tonic and soda water is usually substantially lacking in fizz, but after one or two, who can tell the difference, right? Right!
author: Connie M.

description:
last night i went to the knockout to watch my friends' band play (the aerosols--indie psych trio). bartenders were friendly and attentive for every drink...and it didn't take long to get drinks despite being a bit crowded. they need to get some air conditioning or something in there tho...it got HOT and stuffy. 

pretty cool crowd...and the other band--the parties--were great too. the first band--the matinees--were decent...but didn't seem all that into their music, which makes it that much harder for the crowd to get into it. BUT, the lead singer was SUPER cute...so that def. helped ;) oh, and the aerosols closed with a sick cover of "lucifer sam (...a tall young cat)"--syd barret-era pink floyd. that RULED. 

i realize this is a review of the knockout and i'm pretty much talking mostly about the bands...but hey, isn't one of the most important parts of a bar experience what music's playing? of COURSE it is. rock out with your knockout.
author: dusty d.

description:
Tons of different kinds of beers and the perfect place to meet your friends who've "retired" to Glen Park when you live in the Mission. 

I've only been there for the Godzilla Sushi night hosted by Timmy (ex Tokyo Go Go chef) on Weds night happy hour (6-8). Get there early though, his more popular rolls go early. He and his cohort Erin provide the friendliest service around. 

And, they have a nice little setup where you can sit in front of him, sorta like a makeshift sushi bar. Definitely try to sit in front of him, he'll have you laughing and choking on fish. In a good way of course.
author: J K.

description: Went on Sunday and it was a place where we will plan to go again.  We are new to the area and have been looking for a place with a cozy feeling and maybe some northern soul, motown and garage music might played.  We were all feeling good towards the end of the night.  The crowd was decent and drinks we reasonably priced.
author: Van E.

description: This place rocks. Kiren beer on tap, cheap happy hours, and PBR in cans, what's not to like? Oh, and bingo nights. All that is missing is some wings and this place would be perfect.
author: Hans H.

description: This bar is a microcosm of that which is San Francisco.  A burning man bar with amazing oddball entertainment, you can always find a 400lb woman in a blue sequin dress or a blood-fetish night.   Just...wow!
author: Anony M.

description: I went here Saturday night for the first time; my date recommended it because he wanted to hear the band. I loved the band and the place. This is a very comfortable local bar that had good bartenders and nice customers. I plan on going again to check out Bingo night.
author: E P.

description: Chicken John done sold it.  We'll miss you Dr. Hal.
author: matthew w.

description: Knockout is a large bar, nicely decorated inside.  They have live music here often that I hear is usually OK.  Happy hour prices are nothing to scream about, especially in light of the fact that it is so far out in the Mission (although I really like that area of the city).  The most redeeming quality of the knockout is their Bingo games, which are offered on Thursdays after 8 pm (or whenever it gets crowded enough).
author: Mr. G.

description: The Knockout rules.  Good people, good drinks, good events.  Thursday bingo is awsome and they used to have a karaoke night on Sundays that kicked ass.  I'm not sure if they do it any more but the nights are full of good 60s R&B.  What more could you want.  A gem in the upper mission.
author: jason k.

description:
bingo is rad, so is the bingo girl.  i go there cause its a dark cool lookin bar.  decor is cool.  rad old horror movies playing in the backround.  i'm so gay. i've never seen a band there tho as i really havent noticed any that intrigued me; and i dont really go to shows i have to pay for unless its friends or something i NEED to see.  mostly my roomies drag me there, but its not such a bad place to be dragged to.

Booty basement is super cool!

edited (01/22/08) -  i just realized how lame this review reads.  it should go more like this:
the knockout is i nice medium sized bar with a photobooth and a dark, classic monster movie decor.  bingo on thurs rocks as well as booty basement on the 3rd friday of the month.  my god i use the word 'cool' way too much
author: regan g.

description: I was at the Knockout this past Halloween. DJ Sergio Iglesias kept us dancing all night. The bar staff was friendly. The drinks were reasonably priced. We loved the photo booth and the films of go-go dancers from the 60's.  In addition, the crowd was super friendly and relaxed. The costumes were creative and I swear I didn't see one lame "sexy witch/nurse/police officer in the bunch.
author: Kay O.

description: There is nothing "hipster" about the knockout -  Total nerds and dorks go here to tear it up - I do see the occasional hipster gang wander in, but they never stay long. (thank god - they can be such an eye sore!)
author: gem s.

description: Large Drinks, Nice Bartenders, Excellent music and dj's, check dx, and rye in the sky.  Probably the best city venue in terms of variety and quality of musical billing!
author: Zach H.

description: The non-douchebaggery side of the mission.  Like where latino's live and stuff and white kids hang out....oh wait, this is the next step to the great cleanse.  yikes.
author: Tim T.

description:
A cool place with cheap beer and good music, but, alas:

The most rude bartender in the world (the female one).

And when I took a cherry from the bar, I was escorted out amidst cursing and hulabaloo.

Geeze, guys, as soon as you told me to leave, I started walking. Why did you feel the need to scream at me and act all macho?

Well, you've lost my business, and that all of my friends'.
author: B To The Z.

description: Bingo on Thursdays is fun on a stick.  However, the band that was warming up before Bingo started sounded like nails on a chalkboard.  It was near impossible to have a conversation.  I'll forever love my squeaky chicken I won during the game, and will go back for more!
author: Trisha I.
