description: When you have five bingo cards going and a couple beers the fun just gets better and better. I would tell you what night I was there (was it Thursday?) but the fact that I can't remember is probably the best sign of all. Every beer you get a bingo card and they have some good giveaways. Also on Wednesday they have a killer sushi night (I know but I eat Tamales from a lady that wanders around in the mission so I figure what the hell). The place is super chill and a lot of fun. Away from some of the mission craziness but still can get pretty rowdy on the weekends.
author: Matt D.

description: 5 Stars...Yes, 5 stars and justifiably so! This place from the times I visited, has a wide array of music that's both played live and record spinning by the DJ's. Lot of energy flows here with dancing and drinking. Nice decor and drinks that are served up well. Check it out!!
author: Tom W.

description: family owned and operated. great bartenders that put up with the worst of us drunks. i always have a great time at this bar. sometimes i ride my bike all the way from the richmond district just to get out to kareoke (sunday) or bingo night (thursday). AND it is a place you can almost always catch a great band before they get big and play some other shitty crowded bar. and by that time all the squares have heard the band and ruin it. knockout keeps it real.
author: Goober U.

description: Love this place. Always a good time. If you come on Wednesdays (early like 6-9ish) they actually have a sushi chef there making great rolls and such. Yum :) Bingo on Thursdays is also a good time.
author: r e.

description: i think this used to be the odeon bar(?)  i've only been to shows at the knockout.  a lot of my favorite bay area bands play here, and it is always a good time.  since they moved the stage over, it's a lot better.  there is a photobooth and cheap, strong, big drinks.  the bathroom is pretty clean for a bar too, which is a plus.  it can get REALLY HOT in there, which is really the only downside.  i love seeing bands at this place, and i am very curious to go to bingo night...
author: Kate W.

description: i came here for my birthday and i don't remember much of the night after 2 a.m. thanks, the knockout!
author: Oleya P.

description: last night was BOB SEGER tribute night, and while my friend and i made the tough decision not to pay the cover to see tribute, i checked the crowd outside and peeped in and i feel i could dig this joint.
author: ms.kiki g.

description: seriously if you are going to keep having those hipster dance parties here,figure out a more room situation!
author: Lauren V.

description: Nice little dive, saw the Prayers and the Muslims there this week, decent sound system, good tap list (Bear Republic Racer 5, among others), one of the closer Mission hipster bars to the Excelsior.
author: Noah E.

description:
I went to Knockout for the first time last thursday night and I want to start by nominating the bartender for the "BIGGEST DOUCHE IN THE UNIVERSE" award.  I got my ID checked by a cute girl at the door (good so far).  It wasn't that busy so i didnt feel bad about asking the bartender if they had any lagers on tap.  He told me one I'd never heard of before and I asked how dark is it.  Now, I kind of drink a lot of beer and I know what lager is (motherfucker) it was a simple question that warranted a simple, straight-forward answer.  I asked because I don't really like the lightest lagers that taste like nothing. Is that a crime?  NO ITS NOT.  He stared at me and asked condescendingly  "did someone check your ID at the door?"  I said yeah, but his evaluation of my question as completely retarded pissed me off and I asked him bitterly if he wanted to check it himself. I handed it to him and he said:  "I dont believe this ID"  What does that mean?  It's obviously me.  It happens to be a Michigan issued one since thats where I'm from.  I stared dumbfounded and told the asshole to scan it, which he did.  HE STILL DIDN"T BELIEVE THAT MY ID WAS LEGIT!!  He asked me "when did they start issuing these"  WTF?!  WHO KNOWS THAT?!  When did they start issuing CA IDs the way they currently look?  Douche-bag definitely doesn't know the answer.  I took my ID back and left with my three friends who had already ordered beers but no longer wanted them.  

I'm amazed at this guy's false sense of authority which just ended up making him look like an ass, losing his owner money ( we collectively spent over $300 that night at the next bar we went to), and losing him a third of his tips for the night (that number is based on how few ppl were there when we we arrived at 11:30 ish).  

Asshole bartender dude:   I know you are probably used to hipsters who only order PBR cans.  I just wanna say I'm really sorry that you don't know how to work the tap and have no knowledge of your beer selection or the term "customer service". 

Maybe you will have better luck there if you go.  Just shut up, don't ask questions, order a PBR and you'll be fine  ;D
author: Lauryn S.

description:
i love this place... best staff, cheap & strong drinks, music!
nuff said.
author: layla s.

description: good dive bar.  cheap pints.
author: pauline e.

description: young, hip, casual bar. rather small but clean and interesting and last night was really crowded and really hot inside. i could see the moisture on the windows before i walked in. it was amazing feeling the contrast between standing inside and then walking outside. some bands were playing (which were really entertaining IMHO). had to pay 6 for cover; not that bad considering i stuck to the 2 buck hamms. the people were friendly but that night was just a little crowded, but there were a good ratio of girls to guys. three people stepped on the same foot and i was right up against the dividing wall. oh well that happens. but anyhow  the staff was pretty cool and attentive. i saw one that was constantly running around tidying up the place. kudos to her. i would like to go back and get stupid drunk if i lived nearer to it but its not really worth it if your coming from the east bay unless u got a place to crash in the city. also, parking sucks around that area, so if u want to catch a show, arrive early. oh yea...sort of hard to find if u haven't been there before, its literally at the end of valencia street. if you found the burger king there, its right across the street pass valencia.
author: Eric R.

description: this place is my second favorite place, now actually the favorite since the other one closed. the owners, bartenders are the best. the music is always great. the sundays when they used to play all the trad. ska, reggae and rocksteady. oldie nights, soul nights. Bre is fuckin kool as fuck. i don't get in there as much as i would like due to my work, but when i do i love it
author: Ausewaldoe J.
